snippet: The explosion occurred less than 20 minutes after a neighbor called to report a gas odor that had increased overnight.
abstract: Explosion levels two buildings on 116th Street and Park Avenue in Manhattan, killing at least three people and wounding at least two dozen more; nine occupants remain missing as rescue crews continue to search through rubble in East Harlem; blast, which city officials say was touched off by a gas leak, comes less than 20 minutes after building residents reported a smell that had been detectable since night before.
lead_paragraph: The explosion occurred less than 20 minutes after a neighbor called to report a gas odor that had increased overnight.

headline.main: At Least 3 Killed as Gas Explosion Hits East Harlem
headline.print_headline: At Least 3 Killed as Gas Explosion Hits East Harlem
